definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: You're the shrink. I'm not big on self-affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 你才是心理医生，我才不会那么自作主张。

sentences.english: Brook It implies self-assertion and defiance.
Lightman : You're the shrink . I'm not big on self- affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 你才是心理医生，我才不会那么自作主张。

sentences.english: For some reason, this attendant bought the horse's bones with half of the gold he took.
sentences.chinese: 侍臣自作主张用五百两黄金买了死马的马骨。

sentences.english: Bennigsen, on his own responsibility, ordered the troops to be moved on to the high-road.
sentences.chinese: 贝尼格森自作主张，命令把军队都转移到高地上去。

sentences.english: Jade home woke up and found wei macro self-assertion, were passed out again.
sentences.chinese: 玉家醒来，发现伟宏自作主张，被气得又再昏倒。

sentences.english: Cui Xiuya daughter very worried so self-assertion, to filial piety back South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 崔秀雅非常担心女儿于是自作主张将孝恩接回了韩国。

sentences.english: Youth Self assertion, because small mistakes and blunders.
sentences.chinese: 青年自作主张，会因为小失误而犯大错。

definition: lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later
cavalier/offhand/reckless
to take sth for granted

to urge sb on
rash/impudent
to blame
to blame/to rebuke
to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in

careless/negligent/sloppy/not serious
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to be determined to/to insist on
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
